The deactivation of sweet taste receptors by glucose is not a binary process, where any concentration of glucose will deactivate the receptors. Studies have shown that sweet taste receptors are activated by glucose concentrations as low as 0.1 mM (millimolar) and as high as 10 mM. However, the response of the receptors to glucose concentration is non-linear, meaning that the effect of glucose on the receptors decreases as the concentration increases.
